tests.sic.rnqt.norm

Class RnQTCnorm

  • java.lang.Object
    • tests.sic.rnqt.norm.RnQTCnorm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, FunctionIntf

    public class RnQTCnorm
extends java.lang.Object
implements FunctionIntf
    function implements the continuous-time long-run expected cost of a periodic review, single echelon inventory control system facing exogenous demands generated in a period of length T, from a normal process with parameters N(μ T, σ^2 T) with σ>0. The system faces linear holding and backorder costs with cost rates h>0 and p>0. It also faces fixed costs: fixed review cost per period Kr≥0, and fixed order cost Ko≥0. Finally, there is a constant lead-time for each order being placed equal to L≥0. The control parameters then, are r (the reorder point), Q (the batch size), and T (the review interval).

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2018

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou
    See Also:

      • eval

        public double eval(java.lang.Object x,
                   java.util.HashMap param)
        evaluate the long-run expected cost of a single echelon inventory control system facing normal demands with linear holding and backorder costs and fixed review and order costs controlled by (R,nQ,T) periodic review policy.
        Specified by:
        eval in interface FunctionIntf
        Parameters:
        x - double[] representing R, Q and T
        param - HashMap unused
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - unchecked if the computations go awry, see method evalBoth(x).

      • evalBoth

        Pair evalBoth(java.lang.Object x)
        evaluate the long-run expected cost of a single echelon inventory control system facing normal demands with linear holding and backorder costs and fixed review and order costs controlled by (R,nQ,T) periodic review policy. It returns in a pair of doubles, both the actual value as well as the value when the order cost Ko is zero, forming a lower bound on the cost function.
        Parameters:
        x - double[] or popt4jlib.DblArray1Vector representing R, Q and T
        Returns:
        utils.Pair // Pair<Double result, Double lowerbound>
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - unchecked if Po is computed outside [0,1] or if any number computed turns out to be Double.NaN.

      • Ksi

        private double Ksi(double r,
                   double tau,
                   double l,
                   double D)
        implements the function Ξ(r,tau|l,D) defined in formula (5-61) in page 259 of G Hadley and TM Whitin: Analysis of Inventory Systems, Prentice-Hall, 1963.
        Parameters:
        r - double
        tau - double
        l - double mean demand in one period
        D - double demand variance in one period
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if any of the computations results in Double.NaN, which can happen when systems with very low variance (sigma) are optimized

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        invoke as java -cp <classpath> tests.sic.rnqt.norm.RnQTCnorm <r> <Q> <T> <Kr> <Ko> <L> <μ> <σ> <h> <p>. The constraints on the variables and parameters values are as follows:
        • T≥(3.5*σ/μ)^2
        • σ>0
        • h>0
        • p>0
        All numbers (except r) must be non-negative. The reorder point variable r may take any real value.
        Parameters:
        args - String[]
